intro: Psittacanthus carinatus, commonly known as the humped fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, humped-shaped fronds. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in many regions.
